intro: Koeleria vallesiana var. mediterranea, commonly known as the Mediterranean wild oat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with numerous tiny flowers, which are adapted for wind pollination. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in dry, sunny environments. This variety is characterized by its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soils.
